DataElement.preferredName: Generalized Health Diagnosis Clinical Diagnosis ICD-O-3 Morphology Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Widespread; broadly dispersed.:Health refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_Five-digit codes representing the histology  (morphology) of neoplasms from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3). The first four digits indicate the specific histological term. The fifth digit after the slash or solidus (/) is a behaviour code which indicates whether a tumour is malignant, benign, in situ, or uncertain whether benign or malignant.

In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Widespread; broadly dispersed.:Health refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. Concepts.definition: Refers to a person's state of physical, mental and social well-being; usually it refers specifically to the state of being in good health, a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and does not consist only of the absence of disease or infirmity. In any organism health constitutes a form of homeostasis with inputs and outputs of energy and mass in approximate equilibrium allowing for growth and continued survival. In humans, a subjective feeling of well-being coming from somatic and cognitive perceptions is considered an essential component of health.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/28/10 Released for use in caTissue Suite version 1.1 and/or 1.2 per owners direction.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Five-digit codes representing the histology  (morphology) of neoplasms from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3). The first four digits indicate the specific histological term. The fifth digit after the slash or solidus (/) is a behaviour code which indicates whether a tumour is malignant, benign, in situ, or uncertain whether benign or malignant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, third edition (ICD-O-3).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
